text: Trapania nebula is a species of sea slug, a dorid nudibranch, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Goniodorididae.Bouchet, P. (2015). Trapania nebula. In: MolluscaBase (2015). Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species on 2015-10-20 ==Distribution== This species was described from Madang, Papua New Guinea. ==Description== This goniodorid nudibranch is translucent grey-brown with an irregular pattern of white covering most of the body. The rhinophores and gills are edged with yellow or orange.Rudman, W.B., 2008 (March 10) Trapania nebula Gosliner & Fahey, 2008. [In] Sea Slug Forum. Australian Museum, Sydney. ==Ecology== Trapania nebula probably feeds on Entoprocta which often grow on sponges and other living substrata. ==References== Category:Goniodorididae Category:Gastropods described in 2008
title: Trapania nebula
